Name: Go to file
Description: Can i jump to file by searching for a filename?
Author: @pankajparashar

Chrome.Notes: 1. Run Command menu using `Cmd+Shift+P` (on Mac) or `Ctrl+Shift+P` (on Windows/Linux) > Type filename to filter on the matching files > Press `Enter`.
Chrome.Name: Go to file

Firefox.Notes:
1. In the **Debugger** tab, use `Cmd+P` or `Ctrl+P` to open the search panel where you can type keyword to search for matching filenames.
2. Press `Enter` to trigger the search.
Firefox.Name: Go to file

Edge.Notes:
1. Open devtools using `Cmd+Opt+I` (on Mac) or `Ctrl+Shift+I` (on Windows/Linux) > Sources.
2. Run Command menu using `Cmd+Shift+P` (on Mac) or `Ctrl+Shift+P` (on Windows/Linux) > Type filename to filter on the matching files > Press `Enter`.
Edge.Name: Go to file

Safari.Name: Go to file
Safari.Notes: 1. Anywhere in the web inspector, press `Cmd+P` to search for files matching the filename.

Opera.Notes:
1. Open devtools using `Cmd+Opt+I` (on Mac) or `Ctrl+Shift+I` (on Windows/Linux) > Sources.
2. Run Command menu using `Cmd+Shift+P` (on Mac) or `Ctrl+Shift+P` (on Windows/Linux) > Type filename to filter on the matching files > Press `Enter`.
Opera.Name: Go to file
